meanings.definition: Each of ten equal groups into which a set of data is divided, each containing a tenth of the total.
meanings.sent1: In the math class, the teacher explained that deciles help organize data into ten equal parts.
meanings.sent2: The deciles in the income distribution show how wealth is divided into ten equal groups.
meanings.sent3: At the party, they divided the cake into deciles to ensure everyone got an equal share.
meanings.sent4: The deciles acted like traffic lights, controlling the flow of data into ten equal groups.
meanings.sent5: The concept of deciles made it easier to understand how the data was segmented into ten parts.

meanings.definition: A value of a variable that divides a distribution into ten equal parts.
meanings.sent1: The deciles of the test scores helped identify the point where the distribution split into ten equal parts.
meanings.sent2: Researchers used deciles to analyze how the variable was divided into ten equal segments.
meanings.sent3: The deciles of the temperature readings made it look like the weather was playing a game of dividing by ten.
meanings.sent4: Her decision to use deciles as markers in the graph created a clear division into ten equal parts.
meanings.sent5: The concept of deciles visually represented the division of the distribution into ten equal sections.
